Pre-Game Insights: The match between Cameroon and Namibia is part of the qualifiers for the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.
There were controversies over the location of the match and the training arrangements of the Cameroonian national team.
The Cameroon Football Federation (FECAFOOT) received approval from the country’s Prime Minister to hold the match in Garoua.
The decision to host the match in Garoua was defended by Belgian coach Marc Brys, who stated that the Roumdé Adjia Stadium met all necessary requirements for a quality match.
FECAFOOT initially chose Douala for the team’s training base, but Marc Brys opted for Yaoundé, where the entire squad eventually gathered.
Goalkeeper André Onana emphasized the team's professional response and focus on winning the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last two encounters between Cameroon and Namibia ended in a draw and a victory for Namibia.
Ongoing disputes between FECAFOOT and the government continue to cast a shadow over the proceedings.
